CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL police officers , in the course of a murder investigation , searched the applicant ’s home . They found CARDINAL hunting - gun cartridges and arrested the applicant for the unlawful possession of ammunition . On DATE the police opened a criminal investigation against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned as a suspect .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case was referred to ORG of the Zaliznychnyy ORG of GPE . The responsible investigator charged the applicant with the unlawful possession of ammunition and authorised his detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator ordered an expert ballistic examination of the cartridges found in the applicant ’s home to determine whether they fell into the category of ammunition . The expert ’s opinion was submitted on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator questioned witnesses and , on DATE , the police officers who had conducted the search in the applicant ’s home .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case file was transferred to ORG of GPE . On DATE an investigator attached to this ORG took over the case .

CARDINAL . The investigation was completed on DATE and the applicant and his lawyer were given access to the case file . On DATE they finished studying it . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer unsuccessfully requested the investigator to terminate the proceedings for a lack of corpus delicti .
CARDINAL . On DATE the indictment was approved by the district prosecutor and sent to ORG of Kyiv ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge of ORG committed the applicant to trial . In his decision the judge also decided that the applicant ’s “ remand shall remain unchanged ” .

CARDINAL . The court held hearings on DATE , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE . CARDINAL scheduled hearings were cancelled : on DATE witnesses were absent ( the court issued compulsory summonses in their respect for the following sittings ) and on CARDINAL DATE a judge was unavailable . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court heard evidence , but had to adjourn the case due to the failure of the witnesses to appear .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s lawyer requested that the case be referred for further investigation . On DATE ORG granted this request , citing the lack of reliable evidence collected by the authorities . By the same decision , the applicant was released on bail ( a sum of ORG MONEY was deposited with ORG ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) , allowing the appeal of the prosecution , quashed the decision to remit the case for reinvestigation . The court held that any flaws or shortcomings in the evidence could be assessed and , if need be , rectified during the trial .
CARDINAL . DATE the proceedings were stayed pending the outcome of the applicant ’s request for supervisory review of ORG decision . On DATE ORG rejected this request .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG resumed the trial and , on DATE , found the applicant guilty of the unlawful possession of ammunition and sentenced him to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment , suspended on probation . The court relied primarily on the police search record and the expert evidence that the cartridges found in the applicant ’s apartment were indeed ammunition within the meaning of LAW . The applicant and the prosecution appealed . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG recommenced the trial . DATE the court held CARDINAL hearings ( on DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE and DATE ) , during which CARDINAL witnesses and an expert were heard . As on each occasion an unnamed witness failed to attend , the sittings were adjourned .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , on the applicant ’s request , remitted the case for further investigation . The court established that neither the applicant nor witnesses had been present when the police officers found the cartridges in his apartment . Moreover , the warrant was issued in breach of procedural rules and the search report submitted to the court was not the CARDINAL drawn up on DATE and signed by the applicant and the witnesses . The court also indicated that the expert ballistic report could not be used in evidence as it had been produced in breach of procedural requirements .

CARDINAL . On DATE an investigator attached to ORG terminated the proceedings due to the lack of any corpus delicti . The investigator referred essentially to the circumstances relied on by the court when remitting the case for further investigation .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that he was not informed about this decision . Thus , in DATE his lawyer lodged an administrative complaint under LAW , challenging the lack of progress in the investigation .

CARDINAL . The Government stated that the applicant had been informed in a timely manner about the termination of his case and , through his administrative complaint , he had contested the investigator ’s ruling of DATE . However , the decision of ORG of DATE , on this complaint , indicates that the applicant challenged the “ suspension ” ( зупинення ) not the “ termination ” ( закриття ) of his case . Moreover , in his complaint he requested that his case be terminated due to the absence of any corpus delicti .

CARDINAL . In the above - mentioned decision of DATE , ORG held that it had no administrative jurisdiction to determine the applicant ’s complaints since the investigative authorities’ acts and omissions could only be reviewed within the framework of the criminal trial . On DATE ORG upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that it was not until he applied to the ORG , seeking information about the developments in his case , that ORG informed him , by a letter of CARDINAL October CARDINAL , that the proceedings had been terminated . On DATE the investigator of ORG ordered the return of the applicant ’s bail money .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a request for compensation for unlawful criminal prosecution . Its outcome is unclear , although , in view of the subsequent developments ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , it was probably disregarded .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE to terminate the proceedings against the applicant as being premature , and ordered a further investigation into the purported offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator attached to ORG terminated the proceedings due to the lack of any corpus delicti .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code provides :
“ Unlawful ... possession ... of firearms ( except for smooth - bore hunting guns ) , ammunition or explosives without the relevant permission ... shall be punished by imprisonment from DATE . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code enumerates the reasons for the termination of criminal proceedings , including the absence of any corpus delicti .

CARDINAL . Articles DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code oblige the witness , summoned by the court or the investigative authorities , to attend and give evidence . In case of his / her failure to comply with the summons , the authority concerned may issue a compulsory summons , enforceable by the police . The ORG repeated failure to appear in court without valid justification is punishable under LAW .
CARDINAL . Chapter DATE ( ORG CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Code governs the suspension of criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL ( the general principles on the application of preventive measures ) and CARDINAL ( the conditions for a remand in custody ) may be found in the judgment of CARDINAL DATE in the case of GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § DATE ... ( extracts ) ) .

Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the Code ( the application of bail ) and the relevant provisions of ORG . CARDINAL of DATE of ORG of GPE on the practice when applying bail as a preventive measure , are set out in the decision of DATE in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that , on completion of the investigation , the investigator either draws up an indictment or terminates the case .
According to LAW can be closed by the investigator on both exonerating and non - exonerating grounds .
Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL empowers the prosecutor to quash any investigator ’s decision .

At the material time , LAW ( Articles CARDINAL - CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , which regulates the appeal against the investigator ’s decision , did not contain the defendant ’s right to challenge the decision to institute or re - institute criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , citizens are entitled to compensation for damage caused by :

CARDINAL ) an unlawful conviction , unlawful indictment , unlawful arrest and detention on remand , unlawful search , unlawful attachment of property , unlawful suspension from work and other procedural actions that affect their rights ;
CARDINAL ) an unlawful administrative arrest or correctional labour , unlawful forfeiture of property , and the unlawful imposition of fines ;
CARDINAL ) NORP the unlawful conduct of operational investigative activities .
LAW ( the ratione personae scope of this PERSON ) may be found in the judgment of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that the amount of the compensation is determined by the authority which conducted the investigation or the court which tried the case . If the applicant considers the awarded amount insufficient , he / she may challenge this decision before a court or a court of appeal respectively .
